info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 02 at 8:10PM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...An intense snow shower will impact portions of southeastern Missoula and northwestern Granite Counties through 930 PM MST... At 809 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking an intense snow shower over Bonner-West Riverside, or near Missoula, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Moderate snow. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Lowered visisbility and rapidly accumulating snow on roads. Locations impacted include... Missoula, Lolo, Bonner-West Riverside, Wye, East Missoula, Nimrod, Bearmouth, Quigley, Clinton, and Turah. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between mile markers 93 and 143. Highway 93 N between mile markers 0 and 1. Highway 93 S between mile markers 86 and 94. Highway 200 E between mile markers 0 and 1. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
